author: Walter Scott
D J
text:
The family of former President A.P.J. Abdul Kalam has expressed displeasure over his former scientific adviser V. Ponraj launching a political party using Kalam’s name and portrait.

“Thatha [A.P.J.M. Maraikayar, elder brother of Kalam] is totally upset that the name of his brother, who remained apolitical, is being dragged into politics,” said M.J. Sheik Saleem, grand nephew of Kalam.

Soon after launching the party at Abdul Kalam’s ‘samadhi’ here on Sunday, Mr. Ponraj visited the ‘House of Kalam’ but could not meet Mr. Maraikayar, according to Mr. Saleem. “Thathaa was sleeping and we conveyed our wishes to Mr. Ponraj,” he said.

When Mr. Ponraj visited ‘House of Kalam’ about 10 days ago and said that he was being compelled by a section of youth to launch a political party, the family members said he was free to launch a party but made it clear that he should not use Kalam’s name or picture , Mr. Saleem said.

When Mr. Maraikayar learnt that Mr. Ponraj launched a party and named it “Abdul Kalam Vision India Party” and designed the party flag with his portrait in the middle, he was very upset, Mr. Saleem said. Clarifying that the family was not interested in initiating legal action or moving the Election Commission to restrain Mr. Ponraj from using Kalam’s name and picture, Mr. Saleem said, “Let the people ask Mr. Ponraj as why he dragged Kalam’s name into politics .”

Mr. Saleem also made it clear that the family and ‘Dr APJ Abdul Kalam International Foundation,’ which was launched to turn Kalam’s vision 2020 into reality, would have nothing to do with Mr. Ponraj’s party.
title: Kalam’s family upset
